title: suggestions for a title font paired with agenda - medium
content:
Hi Everyone,  
I was wondering if anyone could suggest a good font for my titles and subheads for a project i am doing. It is about 12 pages and the body is agenda medium. I am trying to find something different and get away form using garamond, caslon, or goudy. Any new suggestions? Also, if any of these new fonts come from a free font download website, it would be helpful. My work does not allow any budget for new fonts. Thanks Everyone in advance!
author: Erin Higgins

comments.content: Did i make a typophile faux pas?

You could try some of these, it's difficult to pick a pair for Agenda from freebies, more Hobson’s choice, and you’ll have to check that the EULA allows you to use it commercially.

[http://typophile.com/wiki/FAQ\_Free](http://web.archive.org/web/20150306211156/http:/typophile.com/wiki/FAQ_Free "http://typophile.com/wiki/FAQ\_Free")

Tim

The only free to use for...(check the EULA) font i know that's not looking "garamondish", is Charis SIL (a Charter Clone). Has 4 weights. Maybe this is helpful?  
 [http://scripts.sil.org/cms/scripts/page.php?site\_id=nrsi&item\_id=CharisS...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150306211156/http:/scripts.sil.org/cms/scripts/page.php?site_id=nrsi&item_id=CharisSILfont "http://scripts.sil.org/cms/scripts/page.php?site\_id=nrsi&item\_id=CharisSILfont")
